results.title: Tasmania: its history its heritage
results.creator_credit: Peter Richman and Peter Richman Productions
results.brief_description: This video uses the architecture of yesteryear to analyse what it says about the social, cultural and economic history of Tasmania; Australia’s second oldest colony. There is a variety of architecture and classic buildings examined, from grand homes, public buildings, humble cottages and split paling cabins. Produced in consultation with the National Trust, Tasmania, this video will be enjoyed by anyone interested in historic buildings or the history of Tasmania.

results.title: Tarzan: the collector's classic
results.creator_credit: Edward Kull, Wilbur McGaugh, Ashton Dearholt, Ben S. Cohen, George W. Stout and Ashton Dearholt Expedition Pictures
results.brief_description: This Tarzan collectors edition contains the full length feature “Tarzan and the Green Goddess” starring Olympic champion Herman Brix. Filmed on location in Guatemala, it details the adventures of Tarzan as he assists the expedition of Major Martling and Ula Vale and their quest to take the Green Goddess, a native totem believed to contain a secret formula for a super explosive, back to Livingston. After successfully finding the totem it is stolen by Raglan who is intent on using the formula for Hiram Power’s personal plots, thus disturbing the delicate balance of the jungle. With only Tarzan’s unique knowledge to rectify the chaos that has been unleashed, so follows the journey on the trail of Raglan. Tarzan and the expedition members must also combat a party of natives sent by the High Priest to avenge the tribe and retrieve the Goddess. This Tarzan collectors edition also contains bonus footage, extracts and out-takes from the films of three other well known Tarzan players, including the first actor to play Edgar Rice Burrough’s adventurous character, Elmo Lincoln.

results.title: Tamworth 88: the Bicentennial Country Music Festival
results.creator_credit: Tim Halpin, John Begley, 8 Television Tamworth, 9/6 Cinema Factory, BAL Marketing and Taree
results.brief_description: Documentary music video covering the highlights of the 1988 Tamworth Bicentennial Country Music Festival including the 16th Australasian Country Music Awards. Tamworth is the country music capital of Australia and each year the music festival attracts country music fans from one end of Australia to the other with over fifty music performers and entertainers. Some of those music stars include Slim Dusty, Johnny Chester, Smokey Dawson, James Blundell, Ted Egan, Eric Bogle and John Williamson with his classic “True Blue”. Hosted by Bill Morrison and Keven Knapp.

results.title: Tamara's tapestry world
results.creator_credit: Tadeusz Jaworski and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Tamara is an artist in a field both ancient and modern - tapestry. She is a world-renowned Polish Canadian whose works are hung, from the National Gallery of Canada to the Hermitage in Leningrad. This film is not a ‘how to’ film as much as a portrait of one of the century’s most brilliant artists.

results.title: Tarot: strictly supernatural
results.creator_credit: Justin Hardy, Ludo Graham, Andre Singer and Non Fiction Films
results.brief_description: An informative look at tarot cards and tarot card reading, centering around the mysterious origins of the cards themselves, and the way their meanings and usage have changed over the centuries. Tarot card readers, historians, and parapsychologists discuss the appeal of the tarot, and offer anecdotes and theories as to why people are so drawn to this ancient craft. Also explores the symbolism behind the artwork, the different spreads that can be used in a reading, and the meanings of the major and minor arcana. Narrated by Christopher Lee.

results.title: Tarkine: the forgotten wilderness
results.creator_credit: David Warth and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In the north-west of Tasmania is one of the largest areas of temperate wilderness left on earth, the Tarkine. This documentary looks at the region, the flora and fauna, pristine rivers, landscapes and ecology including excellent footage of Tasmanian devils, quolls, echidnas, platypus etc in their natural habitats and gigantic Huon pines which are over 3,000 years old. However, change could be on the way - the Tarkine area is being surveyed for its commercial worth and with only a small part of the Tarkine coming under the Parks and Wildlife protection, this ruggedly beautiful and isolated piece of wilderness could be under threat. Narrated by Michael Balson.

results.title: Talking to Australians
results.brief_description: This video and guide were prepared to aid overseas students’ undestanding of communication in Australia. They allow the student to consider the similarities and differences in social rules that exist between cultures. The video is 18 minutes long and includes 10 scenes illustrating communication difficulties that the student may experience whilst living in Australia. The guide has been designed to follow the scenes in the video, briefly summarising each scene, discussing potential questions, and commenting about the situation and the associated socil rule.

results.title: Tara's mulch garden
results.creator_credit: Jon Pedersen, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a simple, poetic film about mulching. Tara Callaghan explains the principle of her garden, takes us through the different growing phases, and leaves us with a splendid harvest of healthy vegetables.

results.title: Talking of safety
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, David Evans and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the effectiveness of safety committee meetings. Shows how a newly-appointed safety supervisor at a brick and tile manufacturing plant in England makes his committee work more effectively while promoting clearly defined objectives.

results.title: Tapdancin'
results.brief_description: Tap Dancin’ explores the survivors and revivers of the great days of tap dance through performance, interviews and vintage footage which includes the Hoofers, the Copasetics and Bill “Bojangles” Robinson.
